question: You are going to another country to study. you would like to do a part-time job while you are studying , so you want to ask a friend who lives there for some help. write a letter to this friend.give details of your study plansexplain why you want to get a part time jobsuggest how your friend could help you to find a job
text: I hope you are doing well. Thank you so much for all the support you have given me while applying to the university. I will land in London on the 8th of October ,and I would appreciate it if you advise me on my concerns about finding a part-time job while studying.

My schedule for the first semester is quite hectic. I had to take more classes due to the change in my field of study. There are, however, some vacancies in the mornings and I do not need those hours to study cause studying at night is more suitable for me.
As I told you earlier, I am eagerly looking forward to getting a part-time job in my leisure time. It would help me enormously in monetary matters leading to a stress-free education.

Since you have particularly experienced this situation, and you succeeded in getting a job with flexible shifts and a noticeable salary, I was wondering if it is convenient for you to put me forward for your company vacancies. It would also be pleasant for me to have a chance to work with my brilliant friend.
That would be a kindness beyond my imagination ,and I thank god for having an amazing friend like you. I really appreciate your help. Convey my regards to your parents.
